data: 1 00:01:53,239 --> 00:01:55,032 Bingo! 2 00:02:09,380 --> 00:02:11,257 Fucking hell. 3 00:02:13,593 --> 00:02:15,553 Fucking hell. 4 00:03:05,770 --> 00:03:08,398 - Oh, God... - Keep your shit together. 5 00:03:08,481 --> 00:03:10,441 If you wanna get 'em out of here. 6 00:03:12,277 --> 00:03:14,946 - I can pop these, no problem. - So get to it! 7 00:03:29,294 --> 00:03:31,797 Security, we have a break-in. Get the... 8 00:03:40,138 --> 00:03:42,932 I know who you are. I know what you think... 9 00:03:43,016 --> 00:03:46,853 If you don't wanna get hurt, keep your mouth shut and don't move. 10 00:03:46,936 --> 00:03:48,938 The chimps are infected. 11 00:03:49,022 --> 00:03:52,191 They're highly contagious. They've been given an inhibitor. 12 00:03:52,275 --> 00:03:55,737 - Infected with what? - To cure, you must first understand. 13 00:03:55,820 --> 00:03:57,864 Infected with what? 14 00:04:00,783 --> 00:04:02,326 Rage. 15 00:04:04,412 --> 00:04:07,540 - What is he talking about? - Get the cages open. 16 00:04:07,624 --> 00:04:09,251 No! No! No! 17 00:04:09,584 --> 00:04:13,963 Listen, you sick bastard, we're taking your torture victims with us. 18 00:04:14,047 --> 00:04:15,590 We'll get you out of here. 19 00:04:15,673 --> 00:04:20,595 The animals are contagious. The infection is in their blood and saliva. One bite... 20 00:04:20,678 --> 00:04:23,181 Stop... Stop! You've no idea! 21 00:04:29,479 --> 00:04:32,315 Get it off! Help me! 22 00:04:37,946 --> 00:04:40,073 Get it off! Get it off! 23 00:04:43,451 --> 00:04:46,329 - What's the matter with her? - You have to kill her! 24 00:04:48,790 --> 00:04:51,042 Oh, my God! 25 00:04:55,421 --> 00:04:58,633 - What's the matter with her? - We have to kill her now! 26 00:05:01,302 --> 00:05:02,970 Oh, God... 27 00:06:51,788 --> 00:06:53,290 Hello? 28 00:07:31,702 --> 00:07:33,204 Hello? 29 00:07:51,389 --> 00:07:53,391 Hello! 30 00:09:35,284 --> 00:09:36,619 Hello? 31 00:10:03,104 --> 00:10:04,606 Hello! 32 00:14:56,897 --> 00:14:58,482 Hello? 33 00:15:06,907 --> 00:15:08,534 Hello? 34 00:15:23,215 --> 00:15:24,633 Father? 35 00:15:31,765 --> 00:15:33,725 Father, are you OK? 36 00:15:41,191 --> 00:15:43,360 Oh, shouldn't have done that. 37 00:15:44,320 --> 00:15:46,030 Shouldn't have done that. 38 00:15:46,905 --> 00:15:48,281 Shit! 39 00:16:15,559 --> 00:16:17,686 Over here! 40 00:16:20,648 --> 00:16:23,151 - Over here! - Come on! 41 00:16:35,454 --> 00:16:37,915 Go, go, go! 42 00:16:43,170 --> 00:16:44,213 Keep going! 43 00:16:44,296 --> 00:16:46,757 - What the fuck is going on? - Just shut up! 44 00:16:55,474 --> 00:16:58,060 - Covered everything. - Who are those people? 45 00:17:25,170 --> 00:17:26,880 Let's go! Let's go! 46 00:17:26,964 --> 00:17:29,258 - What the fuck is going on? - Just move! 47 00:17:37,599 --> 00:17:39,392 Come on! 48 00:17:58,746 --> 00:18:03,250 Man walks into a bar with a giraffe. They each get pissed. 49 00:18:03,876 --> 00:18:05,419 The giraffe falls over. 50 00:18:05,919 --> 00:18:10,632 The man goes to leave and the barman says "Oi! You can't leave that lying there." 51 00:18:11,008 --> 00:18:15,012 He says "No, it's not a lion. It's a giraffe". 52 00:18:22,853 --> 00:18:24,772 He's completely humorless. 53 00:18:25,481 --> 00:18:27,858 You two should get on like a house on fire. 54 00:18:30,068 --> 00:18:31,486 So who are you? 55 00:18:33,322 --> 00:18:34,990 You're from the hospital. 56 00:18:35,073 --> 00:18:37,910 - Are you a doctor? - He's not a doctor. He's a patient. 57 00:18:38,869 --> 00:18:40,704 I'm a bicycle courier. 58 00:18:43,373 --> 00:18:47,878 I was riding a package from Farringdon to Shaftesbury Avenue 59 00:18:47,961 --> 00:18:49,796 and a car cut across me. 60 00:18:49,880 --> 00:18:53,217 Then I wake up today in hospital. I wake up and I'm... 61 00:18:53,801 --> 00:18:55,720 I'm hallucinating or I'm... 62 00:18:57,262 --> 00:18:58,638 What's your name? 63 00:18:59,848 --> 00:19:01,058 Jim. 64 00:19:02,726 --> 00:19:05,395 I'm Mark. This is Selena. 65 00:19:09,817 --> 00:19:11,485 OK, Jim. 66 00:19:16,573 --> 00:19:18,366 I've got some bad news. 67 00:19:19,368 --> 00:19:24,832 It started as rioting, and right from the beginning you knew this was different. 68 00:19:25,707 --> 00:19:29,878 Because it was happening in small villages, market towns. 69 00:19:30,754 --> 00:19:33,090 And then it wasn't on the TV anymore. 70 00:19:33,423 --> 00:19:37,010 It was in the street outside. It was coming through your windows. 71 00:19:38,387 --> 00:19:40,180 It was a virus. 72 00:19:40,264 --> 00:19:42,099 An infection. 73 00:19:42,182 --> 00:19:44,518 You didn't need a doctor to tell you that. 74 00:19:45,102 --> 00:19:46,937 It was the blood. 75 00:19:47,604 --> 00:19:49,731 There was something in the blood. 76 00:19:51,608 --> 00:19:55,445 By the time they tried to evacuate the cities, it was already too late. 77 00:19:56,613 --> 00:19:58,615 The infection was everywhere. 78 00:19:59,616 --> 00:20:01,535 The army blockades were overrun. 79 00:20:03,704 --> 00:20:05,622 And that's when the exodus started. 80 00:20:07,791 --> 00:20:10,544 The day before broadcasting stopped, 81 00:20:10,627 --> 00:20:13,880 there were reports of Infection in Paris and New York. 82 00:20:16,633 --> 00:20:18,802 We didn't hear anything more after that. 83 00:20:22,556 --> 00:20:25,350 - What's the government doing? - There's no government. 84 00:20:25,434 --> 00:20:27,311 Of course there's a government! 85 00:20:28,020 --> 00:20:32,066 There's always a government. They're in a bunker or a plane... 86 00:20:32,149 --> 00:20:36,486 No, there's no government, no police, no army. 87 00:20:37,988 --> 00:20:41,074 No TV, no radio, no electricity. 88 00:20:41,658 --> 00:20:45,287 You're the first uninfected person we've seen in six days. 89 00:20:46,663 --> 00:20:48,331 Where's your family? 90 00:20:49,666 --> 00:20:51,668 They're dead. Like Selena's. 91 00:20:52,044 --> 00:20:53,712 Yours will be dead too. 92 00:21:04,056 --> 00:21:07,893 Look, I have to find them. They live in Deptford. I can walk it. OK? 93 00:21:08,352 --> 00:21:10,896 You'll go and come back, yeah? 94 00:21:12,940 --> 00:21:15,109 - You won't. - Yes! 95 00:21:15,192 --> 00:21:17,027 No one ever comes back. 96 00:21:22,866 --> 00:21:24,701 So lesson one. 97 00:21:25,869 --> 00:21:29,206 You never go anywhere alone unless you've got no choice. 98 00:21:30,123 --> 00:21:31,708 Lesson two. 99 00:21:32,542 --> 00:21:36,213 Only travel during daylight. Unless you've got no choice. 100 00:21:38,715 --> 00:21:40,300 We'll take you tomorrow. 101 00:21:40,884 --> 00:21:43,970 We'll all go and find your dead parents together, OK? 102 00:21:45,472 --> 00:21:46,765 Eat. 103 00:21:59,027 --> 00:22:01,905 If you want her to slow down, you'll have to say. 104 00:22:29,141 --> 00:22:30,851 - If there's anyone... - I understand. 105 00:22:30,934 --> 00:22:32,978 - Anyone... - I understand! 106 00:22:35,272 --> 00:22:36,815 OK. 107 00:23:18,523 --> 00:23:19,858 Jim... 108 00:23:20,650 --> 00:23:21,985 Wait! 109 00:24:46,820 --> 00:24:50,782 They died peacefully. You should be grateful. 110 00:24:51,074 --> 00:24:52,742 I'm not grateful. 111 00:24:54,244 --> 00:24:55,662 My... 112 00:24:57,122 --> 00:25:01,627 parents and my sister, we went to Paddington Station, 113 00:25:04,171 --> 00:25:09,510 hoping maybe we could get on a plane, maybe we could buy our way onto a plane. 114 00:25:10,093 --> 00:25:12,345 I remember my dad had all this cash, 115 00:25:12,721 --> 00:25:16,058 even though cash was completely useless. 116 00:25:17,642 --> 00:25:20,770 About 20,000 other people had the same idea. 117 00:25:23,273 --> 00:25:25,442 Crowd was surging. 118 00:25:26,151 --> 00:25:28,486 I lost my grip on my sister's hand. 119 00:25:30,822 --> 00:25:32,616 I remember the ground was soft. 120 00:25:35,035 --> 00:25:38,914 I looked down and I was standing on all these people. 121 00:25:39,456 --> 00:25:43,418 Like a carpet. People who had fallen and... 122 00:25:43,501 --> 00:25:46,963 Somewhere in the crowd there were Infected. It spread fast. 123 00:25:47,631 --> 00:25:50,968 No one could run. All you could do was climb. 124 00:25:52,594 --> 00:25:55,680 Climb over more people. So I did that. I climbed. 125 00:25:55,764 --> 00:25:58,141 And I got up on top of this kiosk. 126 00:26:00,435 --> 00:26:04,147 Looking down, you couldn't tell which faces were infected and which weren't. 127 00:26:05,315 --> 00:26:09,277 Then I saw my dad. Not my mum or my sister. 128 00:26:09,361 --> 00:26:10,696 My dad. 129 00:26:13,573 --> 00:26:15,283 His face... 130 00:26:19,454 --> 00:26:23,375 Selena's right. You should be grateful. 131 00:26:23,458 --> 00:26:28,338 We don't have time to get back to the shop before dark. We should stay here tonight. 132 00:26:31,258 --> 00:26:34,010 My room's up at the top. You two can have that. 133 00:26:34,094 --> 00:26:37,431 No, we'll all sleep in the same room. It's safer. 134 00:27:57,969 --> 00:27:59,429 Jim. 135 00:28:08,772 --> 00:28:10,899 - You're back. - Yeah. 136 00:28:16,821 --> 00:28:18,948 - How was it? - Fine. 137 00:28:20,116 --> 00:28:22,118 Give me a drink of that, will ya? 138 00:28:22,619 --> 00:28:24,746 - It's empty. - Ha! 139 00:28:27,082 --> 00:28:28,542 Here. 140 00:28:31,378 --> 00:28:33,255 I'll start working on them, then. 141 00:28:39,969 --> 00:28:41,971 Mark! Mark! 142 00:28:42,847 --> 00:28:44,974 Selena! Help! 143 00:28:59,364 --> 00:29:01,449 It's clear. 144 00:29:06,830 --> 00:29:09,333 - That's Mr Bridges. - Were you bitten? 145 00:29:10,041 --> 00:29:12,377 And his daughter. From four doors down. 146 00:29:12,460 --> 00:29:15,546 - Were you bitten? - No. 147 00:29:15,713 --> 00:29:18,258 Did any of the blood get in your mouth? 148 00:29:19,384 --> 00:29:20,594 No. 149 00:29:24,514 --> 00:29:25,765 Mark? 150 00:29:28,685 --> 00:29:29,769 Wait... 151 00:29:52,292 --> 00:29:53,919 Get that cleaned off. 152 00:29:56,212 --> 00:29:58,256 Do you have any clothes here? 153 00:29:59,382 --> 00:30:01,259 Um... I... Yes. 154 00:30:01,342 --> 00:30:05,013 Then get them and get dressed. We have to leave now. 155 00:30:05,430 --> 00:30:08,975 More Infected will be coming. They always do. 156 00:30:37,545 --> 00:30:40,757 How did you know? How did you know he was infected? 157 00:30:40,840 --> 00:30:44,594 - The blood. - There was blood on me. It was on you. 158 00:30:44,677 --> 00:30:48,806 I didn't know he was infected. He knew. I could see it in his face. 159 00:30:50,225 --> 00:30:54,271 If someone gets infected, you've about 20 seconds to kill them. 160 00:30:54,646 --> 00:30:59,192 It might be your brother, your sister or your oldest friend. It makes no difference. 161 00:30:59,275 --> 00:31:03,446 Just so you know where you stand, if it happens to you, I'll do it in a heartbeat. 162 00:31:05,573 --> 00:31:09,285 He was full of plans. Have you got any plans, Jim? 163 00:31:09,619 --> 00:31:13,456 Do you want us to find a cure and save the world or just fall in love and fuck? 164 00:31:14,040 --> 00:31:15,667 Plans are pointless. 165 00:31:16,834 --> 00:31:19,546 Staying alive's as good as it gets. 166 00:31:21,130 --> 00:31:22,548 Hey, hey, hey, hey. 167 00:31:23,091 --> 00:31:24,551 What's that? 168 00:31:30,848 --> 00:31:32,600 Let's go. 169 00:32:18,104 --> 00:32:21,024 What is it about tower blocks and shopping trolleys? 170 00:32:21,107 --> 00:32:23,943 Stop talking. It's a long way up. 171 00:32:34,203 --> 00:32:36,122 Do you need a break? 172 00:32:37,749 --> 00:32:39,751 - You? - No. 173 00:32:42,211 --> 00:32:44,213 Now I do need a break. 174 00:32:55,016 --> 00:32:56,100 What's up? 175 00:32:56,893 --> 00:32:58,061 Nothin'. 176 00:33:01,064 --> 00:33:02,482 I got a headache. 177 00:33:02,565 --> 00:33:04,067 - Bad? - Pretty bad. 178 00:33:04,150 --> 00:33:08,738 - Why didn't you say something before? - I didn't think you'd give a shit. 179 00:33:10,990 --> 00:33:15,119 You've got no fat on you and all you've had to eat is sugar. 180 00:33:15,203 --> 00:33:16,663 So you're crashing. 181 00:33:17,580 --> 00:33:19,707 There isn't a lot we can do about that 182 00:33:19,791 --> 00:33:24,671 except pump you full of painkillers and give you more sugar. As for sugar, 183 00:33:24,796 --> 00:33:27,299 Pepsi or Lilt? 184 00:33:28,424 --> 00:33:30,176 Do you have any Tango? 185 00:33:30,468 --> 00:33:33,471 Actually, I did have a can of Tango somewhere. 186 00:33:34,639 --> 00:33:36,891 Quiet! That's an Infected. 187 00:33:47,151 --> 00:33:48,986 Oh no, they're in. Move! 188 00:33:51,864 --> 00:33:53,991 Wait up, Selena! 189 00:33:55,618 --> 00:33:57,286 Wait for me, please! 190 00:33:57,370 --> 00:33:59,706 Please, Selena! Please! 191 00:33:59,789 --> 00:34:02,125 - Wait for me! - Come on! 192 00:34:02,208 --> 00:34:04,210 - Run! - Wait! 193 00:34:04,961 --> 00:34:07,630 Please! For fuck's sake! 194 00:34:08,131 --> 00:34:10,842 Selena! 195 00:34:12,218 --> 00:34:15,263 Down the corridor. Flat 157. Move! 196 00:34:15,346 --> 00:34:16,973 Thank you. Thank you. 197 00:34:30,278 --> 00:34:31,905 Open the door! 198 00:34:37,827 --> 00:34:39,412 Open the door! 199 00:34:44,000 --> 00:34:46,627 - Open up! - Where's Dad? 200 00:34:46,711 --> 00:34:48,171 What? 201 00:34:50,673 --> 00:34:53,509 - Open the fucking door! - Where's Dad? 202 00:34:53,801 --> 00:34:56,095 Let them in, Hannah. Let them inside. 203 00:35:04,103 --> 00:35:06,147 Go in. Go in! 204 00:35:24,373 --> 00:35:26,792 So, I'm Frank, anyway. 205 00:35:26,876 --> 00:35:28,127 Jim. 206 00:35:29,837 --> 00:35:32,757 - Selena. - Selena. Good to meet you. 207 00:35:32,840 --> 00:35:34,884 This is my daughter Hannah. 208 00:35:35,051 --> 00:35:37,094 Come on, sweetheart. Say hello. 209 00:35:38,763 --> 00:35:39,931 Come on. 210 00:35:41,724 --> 00:35:43,226 So... 211 00:35:43,559 --> 00:35:45,520 This is great. Just great. 212 00:35:47,980 --> 00:35:50,274 Calls for a celebration, I'd say. 213 00:35:50,358 --> 00:35:53,278 Why don't you all sit down and... 214 00:35:53,361 --> 00:35:55,863 Hannah, what have we got to offer? 215 00:35:56,405 --> 00:35:58,282 We've got Mum's crème de menthe. 216 00:35:58,908 --> 00:36:00,827 Great. Crème de menthe. 217 00:36:01,911 --> 00:36:04,539 Oh, yeah. Look, sit, please. 218 00:36:04,622 --> 00:36:06,249 Get comfortable. 219 00:36:09,961 --> 00:36:13,047 - Where are the bloody glasses? - Middle cupboard. 220 00:36:13,130 --> 00:36:15,883 Nah, the good ones. It's a celebration. 221 00:36:15,967 --> 00:36:17,427 Top cupboard. 222 00:36:18,719 --> 00:36:20,429 So this is your place? 223 00:36:22,640 --> 00:36:24,058 It's nice. 224 00:36:37,446 --> 00:36:38,656 There. 225 00:36:38,739 --> 00:36:41,826 I know it isn't much but, well, cheers. 226 00:36:42,201 --> 00:36:43,619 Cheers. 227 00:37:05,182 --> 00:37:06,684 You OK in there, Jim? 228 00:37:08,060 --> 00:37:09,562 Yeah. 229 00:37:10,521 --> 00:37:12,607 Sorry we couldn't spare the water. 230 00:37:13,065 --> 00:37:16,152 Same with the toilet. The flush doesn't work. 231 00:37:17,737 --> 00:37:19,739 You'll have to use the bucket. 232 00:37:26,829 --> 00:37:29,040 Have to empty it each morning. 233 00:37:29,498 --> 00:37:32,585 Just chuck it over the balcony. No mod cons here. 234 00:37:33,044 --> 00:37:34,754 It's fine. 235 00:37:34,837 --> 00:37:38,007 Listen, it's late. We're gonna turn in. 236 00:37:39,884 --> 00:37:41,803 We have a spare room. 237 00:37:43,054 --> 00:37:44,305 In there. 238 00:37:44,388 --> 00:37:46,348 Are you and Selena...? 239 00:37:47,892 --> 00:37:49,727 No. No, no, no. 240 00:37:49,810 --> 00:37:51,478 Um... 241 00:37:51,562 --> 00:37:53,940 I'll take the living room. It's fine. 242 00:37:54,023 --> 00:37:55,900 Right. 243 00:37:56,484 --> 00:37:58,569 No, I mean, yeah. 244 00:37:59,904 --> 00:38:01,489 So, um... 245 00:38:02,865 --> 00:38:05,451 - Goodnight, then. - Yeah. Goodnight, Frank. 246 00:38:20,466 --> 00:38:22,009 Very spruce. 247 00:38:23,177 --> 00:38:26,013 - Very shredded. - Yeah. 248 00:38:30,476 --> 00:38:33,813 - So what do you make of them? - Well, they're desperate. 249 00:38:35,356 --> 00:38:37,858 Probably need us more than we need them. 250 00:38:39,944 --> 00:38:41,737 I think they're good people. 251 00:38:44,782 --> 00:38:46,701 - Good people? - Yeah. 252 00:38:49,495 --> 00:38:53,541 You should be more concerned about whether they're gonna slow you down. 253 00:38:54,417 --> 00:38:58,004 - Because if they slowed you down... - I'd leave them behind. 254 00:38:58,087 --> 00:39:00,006 - In a heartbeat. - Yeah. 255 00:39:00,923 --> 00:39:02,258 I wouldn't. 256 00:39:02,925 --> 00:39:05,636 Then you're gonna wind up getting yourself killed. 257 00:39:14,478 --> 00:39:16,146 I'm gonna get some sleep. 258 00:39:19,150 --> 00:39:20,443 Selena... 259 00:39:22,319 --> 00:39:25,281 You think I don't get it, but I do get it. 260 00:39:27,116 --> 00:39:30,536 And I know I'd be dead already if I hadn't met you. 261 00:39:31,495 --> 00:39:33,080 Sure. 262 00:39:33,289 --> 00:39:34,874 No, look... 263 00:39:37,334 --> 00:39:39,044 I mean, thank you. 264 00:39:42,465 --> 00:39:44,133 And I mean, sure. 265 00:39:45,134 --> 00:39:46,636 Goodnight, Jim. 266 00:39:47,678 --> 00:39:48,888 Goodnight. 267 00:40:03,194 --> 00:40:05,237 We lost water pressure three weeks ago. 268 00:40:05,321 --> 00:40:09,450 I thought we'd be OK with the water from the other flats. Cisterns and tanks. 269 00:40:09,784 --> 00:40:12,203 But it vanishes so quick you wouldn't believe. 270 00:40:16,332 --> 00:40:18,042 You drink it, 271 00:40:18,167 --> 00:40:19,794 it evaporates, 272 00:40:19,877 --> 00:40:21,545 turns stagnant. 273 00:40:24,340 --> 00:40:26,175 They're all empty. 274 00:40:27,384 --> 00:40:29,386 Hasn't rained in ten days. 275 00:40:29,553 --> 00:40:33,766 You can set up a plastic sheet to catch dew and condensation. 276 00:40:33,849 --> 00:40:37,853 Saw it on TV once, but I can't make it work. 277 00:40:38,896 --> 00:40:40,439 You'd never think it. 278 00:40:42,024 --> 00:40:43,984 Needing rain so badly. 279 00:40:46,529 --> 00:40:48,531 Not in fucking England! 280 00:40:53,744 --> 00:40:56,247 Jim, we're not going to be able to stay here. 281 00:41:05,798 --> 00:41:09,301 - There's been no broadcasts for weeks. - Just listen. 282 00:41:09,385 --> 00:41:14,056 Salvation is here. The answer to Infection is here. 283 00:41:14,140 --> 00:41:17,018 If you can hear this, you're not alone. 284 00:41:17,101 --> 00:41:21,981 There are others like you. There are other survivors. 285 00:41:22,064 --> 00:41:23,857 We are soldiers and we are armed. 286 00:41:23,941 --> 00:41:27,486 Oh, my God. Soldiers. 287 00:41:27,570 --> 00:41:32,325 - Quiet. There's more. - Our location is the 42nd blockade, M602, 288 00:41:32,408 --> 00:41:35,536 27 miles northeast of Manchester. 289 00:41:35,619 --> 00:41:39,081 - You must find us. Salvation is... - Now it just repeats. 290 00:41:39,748 --> 00:41:42,293 - It's a recording? - Yeah, it's a recording. 291 00:41:42,376 --> 00:41:44,879 But this is where it's telling us to go. 292 00:41:45,004 --> 00:41:46,422 Just there. 293 00:41:48,841 --> 00:41:52,261 The way things are, we might need two or three days to get up there. 294 00:41:53,762 --> 00:41:55,055 "We"? 295 00:41:59,518 --> 00:42:05,524 Sound carries in this flat. Me and Hannah do need you more than you need us. 296 00:42:05,608 --> 00:42:08,736 - Look, I didn't... - No, it's OK. It's the truth. 297 00:42:08,819 --> 00:42:11,280 I can't leave the block if it's the two of us. 298 00:42:11,572 --> 00:42:14,825 Something might happen to me. Hannah'd be alone. I couldn't risk it. 299 00:42:15,492 --> 00:42:17,202 But with other people... 300 00:42:17,286 --> 00:42:21,373 If it's a recording, the soldiers who made it could be dead. 301 00:42:21,749 --> 00:42:24,877 - It's possible. - That stuff about the answer to Infection... 302 00:42:24,960 --> 00:42:29,548 There is no answer! It's already done all the damage it can! 303 00:42:29,632 --> 00:42:32,551 - Maybe they have a cure. - Maybe they've got nothing. 304 00:42:32,635 --> 00:42:36,722 - The only way to find out is to reach them. - We could die trying, Frank! 305 00:42:38,891 --> 00:42:40,267 Or die here. 306 00:42:41,060 --> 00:42:46,982 And anyway, it isn't true what Dad said. You need us just the same as we need you. 307 00:42:48,317 --> 00:42:50,194 We need each other. 308 00:42:50,319 --> 00:42:54,031 And we'll never be safe in the cities. The soldiers could keep us safe. 309 00:42:56,325 --> 00:42:58,410 So we have to try and get there. 310 00:42:59,495 --> 00:43:00,830 Get there how? 311 00:43:12,549 --> 00:43:16,303 Just so you know, I don't take checks or credit cards. 312 00:43:44,873 --> 00:43:47,793 - What do you think? - It's the most direct route. 313 00:43:47,876 --> 00:43:53,257 Then we should take the indirect route. The one in daylight and not underground. 314 00:43:53,340 --> 00:43:55,551 Let's just get it done. 315 00:44:08,397 --> 00:44:10,566 No, no. 316 00:44:10,733 --> 00:44:13,235 No. See, this is a really shit idea. 317 00:44:14,028 --> 00:44:17,489 You know why?
